tasks.title: Test smoke detectors
tasks.description: Test your smoke detectors monthly. It takes about 5 minutes. Check it off your list and keep your family safe.

tasks.title: Deep cleaning
tasks.description: Deep clean your house each month to avoid grime and pests. Make a list of areas to scrub and divide the tasks. Regular cleaning makes it easier than doing it infrequently.

tasks.title: Replace HVAC air filters (every 3-6 months)
tasks.description: Replace your air filter every three months to maintain air quality and HVAC efficiency. They are cheap and easy to replace. Order them online if needed.

tasks.title: Inspect fire extinguishers
tasks.description: Inspect your fire extinguishers regularly. Store them in accessible locations, especially near kitchens and furnaces.

tasks.title: Clean garbage disposal
tasks.description: Clean your garbage disposal each month to avoid odors and damage. Use cut-up lemons or ice cubes for cleaning. Baking soda and vinegar also work well.

tasks.title: Unclog drains
tasks.description: Keep your drains clear of food and hair to prevent clogs. Use products like Drano for effective cleaning.

tasks.title: Clean the range hood and filter
tasks.description: Clean the range hood and filter regularly to prevent grease buildup. Wipe the hood with soap and water, and soak the filter in hot, soapy water.

tasks.title: Wash outside windows and siding
tasks.description: Rent a power washer to clean your windows and siding each spring. You’ll be surprised at how much dirt accumulates.

tasks.title: Clean gutters and downspouts
tasks.description: Clear your gutters and downspouts to prevent water damage. Debris can block water flow and create a home for pests. Clean twice a year.

tasks.title: Pump the septic tank (if you have one)
tasks.description: Pump your septic tank every 3-5 years. Schedule it after the snow melts.

tasks.title: Inspect roof and chimney for any damage, cracks or leaks
tasks.description: Inspect your chimney each spring for damage from winter weather. Hire a professional to check bricks, mortar, and flue.

tasks.title: Get the Air Conditioning system serviced
tasks.description: Service your central air conditioning system each spring before summer use. This includes cleaning and inspecting the entire system, usually costing $100 to $150.

tasks.title: Apply pre-emergent to your lawn to prevent weeds from growing
tasks.description: Apply pre-emergent in spring to prevent weed germination. It's easier than dealing with weeds later.

tasks.title: Re-seal the deck, fence, railings and other outdoor woodwork
tasks.description: Inspect your wooden structures each spring. Re-seal if you see splintering to protect against the elements.

tasks.title: Inspect driveway and other exterior concrete pathways
tasks.description: Inspect your driveway for cracks. If you see severe cracking, consider resealing it to prevent further damage.

tasks.title: Inspect your sprinkler heads and test the irrigation system
tasks.description: Check each sprinkler head before using your irrigation system. Make sure nothing is blocking the spray path.

tasks.title: Spray for mosquitos and other bugs
tasks.description: Use Ortho defense spray around your home to reduce bug problems. It’s not a complete solution, but it helps.

tasks.title: Check screen doors and windows
tasks.description: Inspect your screens for rips or holes each spring. Repair them to keep bugs out.

tasks.title: Get your lawnmower blades sharpened
tasks.description: Sharpen your mower blades each year. Experts suggest doing it twice a year, but once is often enough for small lawns.

tasks.title: Get the grill ready for cooking
tasks.description: Clean your grill thoroughly and replace grates if needed. Refill propane tanks to avoid running out.

tasks.title: Mulch
tasks.description: Add mulch to flower beds to suppress weeds and improve soil health. It helps retain moisture and adds nutrients.

tasks.title: Exterior paint touch-ups
tasks.description: Inspect your home’s exterior. Scrape off chipping paint, sand it down, and apply a fresh layer.

tasks.title: Check on the washer and dryer
tasks.description: Clean the lint filter before and after each use. Inspect the dryer vent to ensure proper airflow.

tasks.title: Clean refrigerator coils
tasks.description: Clean your refrigerator coils to maintain efficiency. Dusty coils can increase energy costs.

tasks.title: Clean bathroom vent fans
tasks.description: Remove and clean your bathroom vent fan cover. This takes just a few minutes and helps with airflow.

tasks.title: Test your home alarm
tasks.description: Test your home alarm system each year to ensure it’s functioning properly.

tasks.title: Wash the trash barrel and recycle bin
tasks.description: Clean your trash barrels outside. Use soap and a hose to eliminate odors. This can be a messy job.

tasks.title: Fertilize the lawn
tasks.description: Fertilize your lawn at least once during summer for strength and health. Follow safety precautions when applying.

tasks.title: Get heating system serviced
tasks.description: Service your heating system in the fall before winter use. This includes cleaning, inspecting, and calibrating.

tasks.title: Schedule a chimney sweep
tasks.description: Get your chimney swept before using the fireplace. This prevents buildup and keeps your home safe.

tasks.title: Put outdoor furniture and grill into storage
tasks.description: Store your outdoor furniture and grill for the winter. This helps protect them from the elements.

tasks.title: Seal cracks on windows and doors
tasks.description: Inspect your windows and doors for gaps. Replace weather stripping as needed and seal cracks with caulk.

tasks.title: Turn off outdoor water
tasks.description: Prevent frozen pipes by turning off outdoor water to faucets.

tasks.title: Winterize sprinkler system
tasks.description: Winterize your sprinkler system each fall. Contact a professional to remove water from the pipes.

tasks.title: Rake leaves
tasks.description: Rake leaves from your lawn to allow light and nutrients to reach the grass.

tasks.title: Clean gutters and downspouts
tasks.description: Clear gutters and downspouts of leaves and debris to prevent water buildup and damage.

tasks.title: Overseed and aerate the lawn
tasks.description: In the northeast, fall is ideal for overseeding and aerating your lawn. This promotes healthy growth.

tasks.title: Inspect pipes for insulation
tasks.description: Check your pipes for proper insulation. Keep your home heated to at least 13 degrees Celsius to prevent freezing.

tasks.title: Check attic vents
tasks.description: Inspect attic vents for blockages. Remove any debris or nests to ensure airflow.

tasks.title: Prepare for a storm
tasks.description: Stock up on water, non-perishable food, batteries, and shovels. Consider getting a generator for power outages.

tasks.title: Make sure your entryways are protected
tasks.description: Place mats inside doorways to protect floors. Inspect weather stripping on exterior doors and replace as needed.

tasks.title: Check on insulation
tasks.description: Inspect your insulation for damage or wear. If you find any issues, contact a professional.

tasks.title: Protect your AC unit with a piece of plywood
tasks.description: Do not cover your AC unit in winter. Place a piece of plywood on top to protect it from falling debris.

tasks.title: Insulate hot water tank
tasks.description: Buy a hot water tank jacket to reduce heat loss. This can lower your energy bill.

tasks.title: Pick up a good humidifier
tasks.description: Use a humidifier to add moisture to the air in winter. This helps with dry skin and throat.

tasks.title: Make sure steps and handrails are safe and secure
tasks.description: Inspect your steps and handrails for safety. Ensure everything is secure and stable.

tasks.title: Install storm windows and doors
tasks.description: Install storm windows to reduce drafts. They pay for themselves over time.

tasks.title: Remove window screens
tasks.description: Remove screens in winter to prevent damage from snow and ice. This is a quick task.

tasks.title: Make sure the heat is set to 55 degrees Fahrenheit or higher when you leave your house
tasks.description: Keep your home heat above 55 degrees Fahrenheit to prevent frozen pipes. This saves money on repairs.
